There's no mini challenge this week, so we start off week two in the Storybook house with Max doing what he loves best: trying to get into girls' pants. This townie doesn't mind being charmed, but definitely doesn't want to be sweet talked. She quickly tells Max what she thinks of him. Poor Max. He's not used to being rejected. Max doesn't handle rejection well. He tells that bitch where to shove it. Oh, don't act so shocked, Max. You experienced Arva in nympho mode. You know what she's capable of. Arva isn't impressed with the spying and immediately comes over to give Max what for. While he's in the shower. I don't know what Max did to this girl, but she constantly comes over to knock over the trash can. Guess he's not so much the ladies' man as he thinks he is. Dany came back to the house, so Max re-starts operation Adopt Kitty. It worked. And, of course, the first thing Dany does is attack the garbage can. Sigh. Effing pets. Numair Knight () does not like Max's aggressive approach to sales. Mary-Lynette Ouroboros () isn't a happy customer either. Max sucks at sales. Finally, Numair throws his bags down on the ground and storms out. And he'd bought a LOT of stuff. :( And to top it all off, Max wets himself on the way out of the store. Today is definitely not Max's day. The next day at the store, Numair comes back with a job offer. First of all, it really, really sucks that Max can't take it, since the career isn't opened yet. Secondly, I have no idea what changed since the day before, when Numair stormed out of the store. Apparently he's forgotten how incompetent he thinks Max is. Thirdly, what the hell is the correlation between selling junk and oceanography? I know I spent years working in the deli of my local grocery store just waiting for someone in an oceanography career to offer me a job. Some people have all the luck. Stay classy, Max. Stay classy. After the epic fail that Max has experienced all week, he decides to call Thea over. She'd never turn him down. See? After a little woohoo, Max asks Thea to move in. Of course, she agrees, and she brings $16000 with her. Hello, store upgrade! As soon as she moves in, she calls work to quit her job. And then she gets a makeover! And after giving her glasses, I immediately want to give her black hair and make her an evil witch, because she looks SO much like Elphaba. Holy crap, she's gorgeous. I downloaded her a long while ago and could remember he stats, so I re-rolled them for her. Now she's a knowledge/Popularity sim with an LTW to become chief of staff. She loves guys who like to work out in their underwear, and they've got to be fit. No beer bellies for her men. Although I really want to just go with what my sims want and not force them into anything, Max's kids need to have his last name, which means he and Thea need to get married if she's going to be the one to carry those kids. So I waited until getting engaged wasn't a fear of his anymore, and then I had him pop the question. She's so happy! How could anyone not want to marry her? Oh shut up, Max. Thea helps convince Max that getting engaged isn't such a bad thing. Thea and Dany get acquainted with each other. So far so good! Ooh, someone's pregnant! Oh Max, I'm sorry that you can't get in to go to the bathroom right this second because your fiance is busy cleaning the puke filled toilet, because you knocked her up. How inconsiderate of her. Max had a want to sleep with three different women, and since neither he nor Thea have jobs, he couldn't do it at home since she would immediately catch him. So, he went to his shop. Almost right away, he met this townie whose name I can't remember and got his flirt on. And unlike just about every other townie this week, she fell for his considerable charms. As she should. I tried to make them woohoo in the photo booth, but they wouldn't have it. It's all good though, because before long, ACR took care of everything, and thus, Max fulfilled his want for three woohoos and one for public woohoo. And Thea is none the wiser. Um...not sure what exactly Numair is looking to buy right now. Either he wants to buy the wall, or he's suddenly developed x-ray vision. 's Kermes Kohler-Wielle, Max's newest sales boy, wings it and tries to get the sale. What a challenge for his first day on the job! Yay, gold sales badge! Getting this place up to level 10 and getting a business district will be a piece of cake after this! Only 6 more ranks to achieve. Meanwhile, back at home, Thea pops! Second generation of the Storybooks is on its way! He may be a cheating man-whore, but he does love Thea. I have trouble holding a grudge against him when he looks so cute, holding her like that. D'awww. Speaking of his cheating ways, look who's decided to show up on their doorstep. Max just ignored the doorbell until she went away. And after that near miss, Max decides to marry Thea before she can find out about any of the other women he's slept with. It'll make it that much harder for her to leave him if she does find out. And not a moment too soon. Pop #2! Max and the TV don't get along. Also, who knew that all it takes to fix a TV is to stab it repeatedly with a screwdriver. You learn something new every day. Thea trains Dany the last skill she needs to get a job in the showbiz career. She's been the one teaching the cat her commands, since she's got nothing else to do while Max has been getting it on with other women making a living at the store. And as soon as the skill is learned, Max hops on the computer and gets Dany her job. She starts the next day! Yay! Max and Thea share a romantic meal of catfish served fresh from the pond in the back yard. XD ...Not sure who you're talking to, Max. Thea's...already left the table. O.o Well, this pregnancy has been pretty easy on Thea, all things considered. My sims usually don't have that kind of luck, but thankfully, she hasn't had any close calls or anything. Time for the baby! Max:Oh God, why did I sign up for this?! And daughter Lorelei is born, with Max's hair and Thea's eyes and skin. She is named after a character in Thomas E. Sniegoski's Fallen series. Ohai dere, Leonid! How nice of you to take Port Dover for a walk past the Storybook household. And that's the end of week two for the Storybooks! Stay tuned to see what happens next!

Welcome to week two of the Maplecliffe BaCC! Last time, Arva and Max both moved into the area to build up the new town. Arva became a farmer, and after many problems with bugs, was turned into a plant sim because of all the spraying she had to do to get rid of them. Then she was pretty much a crabby bitch from low moods after that. Let's see if she does any better this week! Okay, so she's not so bad in the daytime, when she's out in the sun. Though you would think that, being a plant sim, she wouldn't want to rip the petals off of her fellow flora. But hey, if it raises her mood, I'm all for it. She'll paint during the day, but after dark, it's like pulling teeth, trying to get her to do anything. She's so effing miserable. Port Dover doesn't look terribly impressed either. Even a good bubble bath doesn't seem to make her happy, though she's getting water from it. Also, is it just me, or does she look a little cross-eyed? Oh yeah. And this week Arva rolled yes to a challenge. This is the one she got. Sweet. We can do that. First male walk-by is Joshua. And this is Leonid. Now, I had no idea how to force them to woohoo, so I figured I'd cheat them into being in love, and then, after they'd done the deed, I'd cheat them back out of love again. ...completely forgetting that I'd cheated both guys into love at the same time and thus, made Leonid jealous when she slept with Joshua. Whoops. Well, at least things aren't boring. She stands for what she believes in...though, considering the cheating on my part, I'm not sure what exactly it is that she actually believes in. Meh, she still beds him in the end. Good little nympho. Somehow I get the feeling that with those binoculars, she can see right into my soul. *shudder* Ooh, Numair Knight! She tries to get it on with him, which would've been awesome, because I love him, but he left the lot before I could cheat them into love to woohoo. 8( I don't know what it is about this lot, but the guys Arva brings home all seem to love catching butterflies and fireflies. That one on the counter behind Leonid is the one that he'd just put there, and though you can't see it, on the counter to the left of the picture is one that Joshua left. Weird. Arva actually spends time teaching Port Dover to play dead. At night and everything. And then she passes out from lack of sunlight. Not gonna lie, I cheated her to 25% sunlight so that she'd be able to live through the couple of hours until it got light out. I couldn't let her die! ......And then she decided to make a snow angel. *shrugs* Again, if it brings her mood up, I'm all for it. Whoa, so I guess she's pregnant. I thought, when she started feeling sick, that maybe she'd lost the baby, but she's okay. Just frozen. This is Stephen. He walked by the house in his underwear, so clearly he knew what he was getting into when he got into her bed. XD Stephen: Ooh, baby, you're so hot, cleaning out your puke-filled toilet like that. .....Yeah, he's not in the running for husband. Liiiiiiiiiittle too creepy. Arva finally had enough money to buy a tiny grocery store! Yay! And this was all she was able to buy for the store. 8( So she can sell tomatoes! Aaaaaaand that's it. Arva's first two customers! One of them is Freya Knight. Yay! She didn't sell much though. Probably $50 worth at most. But once the sun went down, she was in no mood to do anything, so she had to close up shop. .....Great. Thanks Leonid. Because she wasn't already poor enough. Baby time! Boo on the bathroom birth though. It's so tiny that no pictures can be taken from inside, except at awkward angles like these. She had twins! I don't know which one this is. Meh, they're identical at this point. She had two boys, Bryanston and Lobo, both with Arva's skin and Joshua's hair and eyes. And now I start to worry about the possibility that somehow, the alien skin is overpowering all other skin. I'm not sure if it's because, after putting her in a new hood, it's not technically alien skin anymore, and somehow, it's having an effect on everything, because the same thing happened in her last hood, where she and her siblings were born. Dammit, I think I'm going to have to test this out a bit. In the meantime though, Arva proves that she's a good mother, though she does play favourites. Bryanston seems to get all of her attention, while Lobo goes ignored. This dog (whose name I can't remember) walked by the lot, and I decided that Port Dover could use a mate, so I sent Arva to play with him. .....And of course he immediately goes into the house afterward and starts tearing my heart the couch. Sigh. Ooh, hello Max! Fancy you coming by when Arva's in nympho mode! Max: You want to do WHAT to me? I guess he liked what she promised. Port Dover is not impressed. I think she's the only one in the world who hasn't fallen under his charm. Leonid comes by every day to kick over the garbage can. Guess he's still pissed off at her for sleeping with Joshua while he was in the house. Though apparently not enough that he won't jump into bed with her again. XD O rly? Engaged, you say? Aww, he said yes! Meh, it's not much, but it's about 3000 times the amount she currently has, so we'll take it! He is a Family/Grilled Cheese sim with a LTW to become a rock god. But since that job isn't happening, he'll have to settle for Arva being his only groupie. He had a job in the slacker career, so immediately after moving in, he quits. Methinks there might still be a little bit of resentment towards Arva. Time for the babies to grow up! This is Bryanston. He's a whiny little bitch. And his not-evil twin, Lobo. Can you tell which one I like better? Proof that Brianston is a whiny little bitch. He was almost red in energy when Arva put him to bed, yet he screamed and cried until Leonid let him out. Then he immediately crawled out to the doghouse and slept there. Let's throw 'weird' into the description of this kid. Uh, Arva? I don't think that talking about the fact that you love more than one guy is going to help the resentment he clearly already feels for you. Arva: What? I'm just saying that if he doesn't let it go, he can totally be replaced. *cheeky grin* *facepalm* And we'll end with Arva and Leonid being great parents, even though Leonid isn't actually their father. Actually, I have the feeling he'll turn into an even better parent than her. We'll see. With two family sims, it can't be that bad, right? Next up, Max Storybook continues his story!

Welcome to week one of my new Build-a-City Challenge! I blame , because her BaCC is so awesome. lol. I got most of my rules from her at , as well as over at this place over here. I also checked this site out, though I haven't read this one all the way through. So this is the first part. I decided to roll a random number between 1 and 4 to see how many families I'd start out with, and I came up with two. And, since I completely sucked at taking pictures at first, this first update is going to encompass both families. First up, the Ontarios! Some of you might remember the first two generations of Ontarios from the regular legacy I started awhile back. After a few issues with different hoods, I've finally put the gen 3 heir here in Maplecliffe. Hopefully this will be the last move for the Ontario family. So, everyone, say hi to Arva! She's fresh out of college and ready to make a new life in a new place. Of course, her schooling won't have any meaning here, since there are no jobs or anything to speak of. She'll just have to make her own way in the world. She starts out with $24,000, but I forgot to take a picture of her house. Oh, and I also decided to roll every family every week for the possibility of doing mini challenges, but this week, Arva didn't have to do one. Oh yeah, and her stats: Arva is a Family/Fortune sim who wants to marry off six kids. *cries* Well, I guess this town is going to grow REALLY quickly. She likes dudes with brown hair and who aren't afraid to wear a little makeup. No nerds though. And this is her trusty, rainbow-eared dog, of course. Meet Port Dover! She's adorable, but oh, such a bitch. Two minutes into arriving at their new house, and she's already eaten Arva's expensive bed, forcing her to buy a cheap one, since she no longer has enough money for a good one. Stupid dog. So, since Arva can't get a job, and those groceries in the fridge won't last forever, she starts to plant a garden. It takes up most of her days. And this would be why there are hardly any pictures in week one--because she pretty much did nothing but garden. My goal is for her to get her gold gardening badge so that she can open a grocery store. That way, not EVERYONE has to garden to get food. And she's well on her way! After the first day, she gets her bronze badge. And after that, she's too tired and hungry to cook a meal for herself, so she gets the instant meal. I wouldn't trust her with a stove anyway. The last thing we need is for the very first resident to DIAF, on her very first day. Aaaaaaaand this is what happens when she cooks! No fire yet, though, thank God. Give it time. I'm sure she'll cause one eventually. She's kind of a hot mess. Port Dover is not a pig pen, but she is constantly filthy and digging holes and stuff. I've never had to deal with a dog that's needed so many baths. Arva does not have time to give you baths every day! Arva scolds her for being filthy, but she's a good owner. She gives Port Dover love afterwards...right in the pee. Yeah, PD has a tendency to pee on the sidewalk. An entire yard to pee in, yet she always pees on the sidewalk. Still, I suppose it's better than peeing in the house. ..........I'd rather she pee in the house than this. This is at least the second time she's tried to destroy the second bed. And both times, Arva had to wake up to scold her, so that she wouldn't completely ruin the second bed. She can't afford another bed! She could barely even afford this one? Fucking dog. Serves you right. I do not feel sorry for you. Arva's not doing much better. She needs money, but the only thing she seems able to dig up are water pipes. And then it takes her forever to fill them back in. This one here took probably about ten 'fill in's. Apparently it's because she has no body skill, so she doesn't have the strength to fill them in. At least that's what I was told when I googled it. See? Still spraying. Also, apparently Port Dover reeks so much, they can smell her from across the yard. Now that's impressive. Stupid dog. Onto happier times. Hello hot mail lady! And hello even hotter paper girl! You two will make great additions to the families in Maplecliffe. So cute. XD Aaaaaaaaand then she turned into a plant sim. This is what happens when you spend all day tending your garden but can't afford the ladybug houses and thus have to spray everything. She's my first plant sim, and I effing hate it already. But, because phone options aren't available until the population reaches 500, there's no cure for her. D8 At least I can give her normal skin. That's something, I guess. I love that she doesn't need to sleep, but nights are rough without the sun, and I can't find the damn heat lamp. I've been looking. And, even when all three bars are full, at night she gets into terrible moods that seems to have no cure at all. She is adorable when she gives off spores of happiness though. Now she just needs someone to live with, so that they can benefit from them. And, by the time her first week is up, Arva's earned her gold gardening badge! Yay! And, so after that very disappointing first week with Arva, we move onto our second household in Maplecliffe! Meet Max Storybook. He's a Romance/Knowledge sim who wants to be a celebrity chef. Unfortunately, since there are no restaurants in the area, so he's just going to have to be master chef of the household. :( He likes logical girls who like to pretty themselves up. No bearded ladies. Also, he's really hot. XD Oh, and the thing with his name: I've decided that the naming scheme for the Storybook's is that each generation will have names based on different characters from books. Max's namesake is Max, from Where the Wild Things Are. He gets a pre-made starter house, which I already hate because there are no flat surfaces outside, but he can't afford to flatten the land. He only got $16,000 to start with. He'll just have to deal with lumpy ground for now. Arva is Max's first visitor! But apparently they can't speak to each other because the ground is uneven. >:( Stupid pre-made lot. They hit it off when they finally are able to talk though! And Max rolled yes to a mini-challenge, and this is the one he got. Easy enough for a first challenge. I love him so much. Max is so adorable. One of Max's wants is to woohoo, and who should he meet, but 's Thea Ouroboros. Immediately, they hit it off and spend most of the night getting to know each other. This is a good sign! He also hits it off with the hot mail lady. Also a good sign! Yay, treasure chest! Now Max can buy his store! Here it is! It's just tiny for now, and he just sells miscellaneous sculpture decorations for now, until he's skilled enough to sell something else. Max's first customer! Yay! Max has no employees because he can't afford any, so as soon as the first person goes to cash, he shuts the place down so that he can ring everyone up. Once the customers are gone, Max restocks the almost empty shelves. Max decides to try to make friends with Alabama, but Alabama doesn't seem to want to get to know Max. Aww, poor Max. He tries so hard. Effing dog. All Max wanted was to be your friend. :( Max has a bronze badge in fishing, yet apparently he still isn't able to stay on his feet. But finally, after several hours, he finally catches a fish! This is going to be a long, long process. Thankfully, once Arva gets enough money together, she'll be able to open a grocery store, so he won't have to fish to be able to eat. Max:You want ME to flirt with her? *whines* Dude, you're a romance sim, and you've been gushing over her since you first met her. Just flirt with her already! See, that wasn't so hard, was it? Thea clearly loves the gesture. And with that, Max is that much closer to getting his big want. After that, it's pretty much smooth sailing from there. Nothing but kissing and flirting and dancing. I love dates, mostly because as long as they like each other at all, it's a great way to get aspiration and mood up. Um, Max, you do realize that if you DO fertilize her eggs, you're going to have to marry her so that the kid(s) will have your last name, right? Just saying. He didn't care. Look at you, struttin' that ass after the date's over. Yeah, you know you got it. She knows you've got it too. She likes what she sees. Now if only he would get rid of his fear of a relationship. I don't know who keeps kicking the can over, but she even autonomously cleans up his garbage for him. If that isn't a sign of true love, I don't know what is. Meanwhile, Max meets Dany, one of the neighbourhood strays. She has cool eyes, so immediately, he starts trying to make friends. Finally, once the week is almost up, the repo man comes for compensation for the unpaid bills. Well, at least he isn't taking body parts. I wonder if there's a genetic opera repoman default replacement. I've got to look. That would be awesome. The repoman takes a little vase sculpture thing, an outdoor light, Max's mirror, and this fish thing. Could be worse. At least he mostly took stuff that doesn't matter. Ooh, sparkly fish. It's pretty much the only thing left in his fridge, so he's going to have to fish more pretty soon, else he'll go hungry. And we'll finish off the week with Thea visiting Max at the store for a little pick-me-up. Yeah, they're soulmates, even though he denies it with every fibre of his being.
And that's it for the first week! Hope you liked! We'll end with some stats, the format for which I stole from : Maplecliffe, Week 1: New households: Ontario, Storybook Households: 2 Community Lots: 1 Careers unlocked: 0 Sim Multiplier: 2 Total Population: 2 (4) Babies: 0 Toddlers: 0 Children: 0 Teens: 0 YAs: 0 Adults: 2 Elders: 0 That's it! Not much to it so far, but it'll grow quickly! Stay tuned for week 2!

A new year, a new list! I made it just under the wire last year, but this year, I'm going to try my hardest to get my 100 in before December 30th. lol. Also, this year, I plan on writing short reviews on each one. Let's see if I can keep this up. lmao. 1. January 1st - Hamlet (2009) Let's see....Patrick Stewart as Claudius and the king's ghost and David Tennant as Hamlet? Um, yes. Hamlet is already one of my favourite of Shakespeare's plays, but with these two as the leads? I was very impressed. David did a great job as Hamlet. There were only a few brief moments when I was like, "Doctor!" Haha. It was really good. About three hours long, but good. 2. January 6th - 12 Men of Christmas (2009) I know, it's a little bit late for Christmas, but Kristin Chenoweth was the star, so I had to download. I love her. It was a Lifetime movie, so it ended up being your typical Harlequin romance type of story, and not a very good one, at that. Plot holes aplenty. But it was Kristin! So I can't say it was completely horrible. She has to bring in a couple of bonus points, though those points are pretty much the only ones it gets. I definitely don't recommend this one. 3. January 17th - Vicky Cristina Barcelona Meh. I'm not a Woody Allen fan at all, but I decided to give this a shot because someone thought I would like it. And insisted that it was unlike any other Woody Allen movie out there. It was...okay. It did give me a new appreciation for Scarlett Johansson and Penelope Cruz, but I actually thought the movie was a little bit boring. There were moments when I thought it was alright, but for the most part, I was a little bit bored. I ended up playing Facebook games while I watched. So um...sorry, Dominik. It just wasn't for me. 4. January 29th - Small Town Gay Bar I really liked this. It was a documentary from Malcolm Ingram about gay bars in small mid-western towns. It was sad and funny and frustrating, seeing the kind of things people have had to go through just because they're gay. Makes me so glad I live in Ontario. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. 5. January 30th - (500) Days of Summer This was a pretty good movie. It wasn't my absolute favourite, but I like the way it was laid out. The fact that the scenes weren't in chronological order was great. I think that if it had been, the movie wouldn't have turned out as well. I found Joseph endearing and Zooey maddening, but cute at the same time. Overall, I liked it. I don't know if I'd watch it again, but it was good. 6. February 23rd - Dark City It was okay. Sort of Matrix-y, with a hint of Neverending Story, kind of. I did love Richard O'Brien as Mr.Hand. He was creepy and awesome. And Jennifer Connelly was beautiful as always. Summary: The fallout after Noah's surgery.  Reid's POV

<lj-cut text="Aftermath">

"What have you done?" Luke spat at me.

I was stunned, for once in my life.  Luke didn't give me a chance to respond though.  He paused for a beat, and then he turned on his heel and stormed away, ignoring his parents.  Snapping out of it, I followed the younger man, refusing to let him just walk away from me.  I never let anyone get the last word on me, not even this snivelling, self-important trust fund brat.  Especially not him.  He may have found a way to worm his way into my heart, but hell if I was going to let the kid scream at me like this.  I would not let Luke Snyder beat me down.

"What I've done is stabilized Noah," I said loudly as I followed Luke down the hall of the hospital.  "And hopefully he'll make it through the night.  Hopefully he'll wake up tomorrow and be okay."  Who cared if anyone heard what was being said.  Who cared what these small-town hicks thought anyway.  It wasn't as if their opinions meant anything to me.  Luke, on the other hand....Luke's opinion mattered to me more than I cared to admit.

Luke stopped at the sound of my voice, pausing a second before he turned around to face me.  His expression was a mixture of anger, frustration, fear and maybe just a hint of guilt.  I had the feeling that the guilt was what stopped him and forced him to listen to me.  He wouldn't have let me ruin a perfect exit scene, otherwise.  

I gestured for him to move into the floor's staff room and then followed him in.  I stepped a bit closer to him, and I lowered my voice a little as I started to speak again.  "It may come as a surprise to you, but even brilliant minds like mine don't know all the answers.  Even I can't control the entire universe, though I'm not going to stop trying until I reach perfection.  I take calculated risks, Mr.Snyder.  Every surgeon does, when it comes to operating on people.  I'm just better than most at the calculations.  Today, I didn't get the exact answer I'd hoped I would.  Something went wrong, and yeah, it's bad, but it could be worse.  It could be a lot worse.  Noah could be laying in the morgue right now instead of in the recovery room."  Luke winced as I said this, but it needed to be said.  I've always had the best results in arguments when I can shock my opponent into seeing things my way.  Anyway, Luke seemed to be letting go of some of his anger.  I could practically see the balloon deflating a little bit.  Good.  

"I did everything I could in there, not only to save Noah, but to cure him and bring back his sight, so I don't appreciate being screamed at by someone as clueless as you clearly are.  What, do you think I was aiming to kill Noah so that I could have you all to myself?  Please.  All I would have to do would be to wait for him to dump you for the next ridiculous reason he comes up with, and boom, I'd be in again.  I wouldn't risk my medical license--again--just for you, even if I thought it could work.  You're not that important."  There went his anger, rising up again.  I could see it in his stance, his expression.  On a normal day, I liked it like this.  Things were always more interesting when we were verbally sparring.  But this wasn't a normal day.  This wasn't a regular playful sparring match.  This argument could determine the future of our relationship, or lack thereof.  And more importantly, I knew he was scared out of his mind about his ex, and any jealousy I might have felt about the whole situation would have to be put aside for now.  I softened my voice and stepped a little bit closer.  "You know that I would never do anything to intentionally harm a patient, especially Noah, despite my feelings for you.  Because of my feelings for you.  You know that I always do everything I can for my patients, to cure them of whatever ailments they have or at least to make life better for them.  You should know that, especially after what we just went through in Dallas.  At the very least, I want to keep my medical license.  But you should know by now, after what I told you about Annie Chapman, that I do care about my patients, and that I always do absolutely everything I can for them.  I realize this is hard for you, considering he's the love of your life, but you don't have to worry, Luke, because I will do everything in my power to make sure that you two have a long and happy life together."

I looked away then, unable to look him in the eye any longer.  Defense mechanisms had always worked well for me , but now I suddenly felt awkward and unsure of myself.  Well, I supposed there was a first time for everything.  Maybe the whole ordeal was getting to me more than I'd thought.

"I'm sorry I screamed at you, Reid," he said grudgingly, and I looked up at him again to see if he actually meant it.  I couldn't help but feel a little thrill at hearing my name on his lips.  Now he was the one not looking at me.  He was looking off to the side, one hand up, rubbing at the back of his neck.  That was guilt, with a bit of embarrassment and a generous dose of fear, still mixed in.  "I'm just...I'm so worried about him.  If he doesn't...If he can't...."  

He looked so helpless, I couldn't help but go to him.  I placed one hand on his hip and gently caressed his cheek with the other, trying to soothe him.  It was awkward at best.  Maybe there was something I wasn't good at after all.  "We'll make sure he gets better.  I'll make sure he gets better.  We'll find out where we stand when he wakes up, but I promise you, Luke, he will come out of this better than new if I have anything to say about it.  I will do everything I can to make sure he gets better."

Luke looked at me with eyes full of pain but with a little bit of hope too.  They were glassy with unshed tears, and I had to bite my lip to keep from getting emotional myself.  I didn't do emotional, and it wouldn't help Luke right now anyway.  He, on the other hand, looked like he was going to fall apart right here.  I wrapped my arms around him and gently pulled him close, and he came without a fight.  I just hugged him tightly and rubbed his back a little, and he clung to me as if he would collapse without my support.  "It's okay," I told him softly, still rubbig his back.  "We'll get him through this."

He was the one who pulled away first, but only a little bit, just enough so that he was looking at me.  I looked back at him, into his eyes for a moment.  He leaned forward, and I met him halfway.  It was a gentle kiss, just barely a brush of lips against lips at first, but then he increased the pressure a little bit, and I closed my eyes as I kissed him back, trying to pour all the comfort I could into it.  I could feel him relaxing a little in my arms, so I tightened them around him, holding him closer.  This wasn't how I'd pictured our first real kiss to come about, but I couldn't deny that it felt good.  I tried to savour the feeling of him in my arms, his lips against mine.  Who knew if I would ever get the chance again.  I hoped I would, under better circumstances and for the right reasons, but for now I just had to take what I could get.  He pulled away a few moments later and rested his head on my shoulder once again, and I just held him and hoped that it would be enough.

Though it seemed like she had come into this world just a short time ago, Etoile grew quickly into a beautiful little toddler. When I'd first been released from alien captivity with the knowledge that I was going to bear alien spawn, I had been so afraid of the outcome. What would happen when I finally gave birth? Would I even make it through the delivery? And what would it mean to raise an alien baby, assuming I did make it past the birthing process. But it didn't take me long to realize that I'd had nothing to worry about. She was just like any other baby, except that she looked a little bit different. That didn't matter though. Etoile was my unique little angel, and I loved her very, very much. Everyone loved her. Everyone was still upset over the loss of my mom and Uncle Adder, but Etoile made life a little bit easier to bear for everyone. Not only that, but I'd learned a few things during my time with the aliens too, and I used that knowledge to try to make life a little bit easier for the family. For instance, a baby formula that enabled Etoile (and, I'm assuming, any other toddler) to concentrate better on some tasks. She learned how to walk in no time. And potty training? Barely took any time at all. Aunt Ronnie absolutely loved that formula, since she'd been the one to teach Eoile most of her skills. Starla and I were away at work for much of the day, so Ronnie spent most of the time with Etoile. She often mentioned that she'd wished that she'd had that formula when my cousins and siblings and I were kids. Maybe we'd all be smarter for it today, if she had had it back then. Haha. Ronnie wasn't the only one finding success. Starla was making her way up the political ladder quickly. I was so proud of her. She was really proud of herself too. She was getting more and more sway in the office too. Pretty soon she'd be able to make real changes in the way life was lived in the city. Edward, however, wasn't doing as well in school. He was trying, but he just didn't seem able to grasp some of the concepts he was taught. In fact, it got so bad for awhile there, that he was put into some special classes where he could get the attention he needed, to help him with his studies. Everyone at home helped him too, thinking up creative ways to teach concepts he'd need throughout his life. And slowly, gradually, his grades started to get better. We were all so proud of him when he brought home his first A. Tragedy struck soon again though, when Dad passed away. It just seemed to come out of nowhere! It took us all by surprise. We were all so shocked at first. No one could believe that he was really gone. I can't tell you how many times I turned around, expecting him to be sitting on the couch or at the table or coming into the room and being faced with nothing but the realization that none of that would happen anymore. My dad was gone, and he wasn't coming back. We were all devastated. My dad, who had been such a force of life, such a positive influence on everyone, was gone. For weeks, there was barely a smile in the house. I think we all lost a part of ourselves when we lost my father. The kids were the ones who'd ultimately helped us through the grief we all felt. They were just so alive and filled with love and passion for life. So full of smiles. When we looked at them, we were able to...not forget what we had lost, but remember what we all still had to live for. There were still good things in the world, despite the loss of my father. My children showed me that. They really were the greatest gift I could have asked for. And Aunt Ronnie still had some fire in her. Even though Uncle Adder had been gone for some time, Aunt Ronnie didn't let her grudges fade away. Even though Uncle Adder had been gone for awhile, she still got angry every time one of his old conquests came around. I felt a little bit bad for those women, actually. Sometimes Ronnie just liked picking fights. It was great to watch the kids together. Despite the fact that there were so many years between them, they loved each other very much. Etoile loved singing with Edward. He taught her how to sing a nursery rhyme, and after that, she was always singing it and asking him to sing with her. It was really cute. Edward was a really great big brother to her. It wasn't long later though, that we had a fourth tragedy in the house. One peaceful spring weekend, Grim snuck up on us and took Aunt Ronnie away from us. Once again, we were all devastated. We were all just growing accustomed to living live without Dad, and now we had to live without Aunt Ronnie too. It was extremely hard on all of us. Even Etoile, one of the happiest toddlers I'd ever known, was inconsolable. Aunt Ronnie had been like a grandmother to her. She was young, but she knew what was going on. She'd known that Aunt Ronnie wasn't coming back. It was difficult for her to get over the loss. Life went on though, and before long, Etoile was old enough to attend school. She was so excited. She'd always wanted to go to school with Edward when she was younger, and now she was finally able to. Her first report card hadn't been the greatest, but she turned it around quickly after that. My Etoile was one smart cookie. I was so proud of her. I was proud of both of my kids. Edward was growing up into a respectable young man. He was doing well in school too now, and the fact that he worked hard for his grades made him a favourite with all of his teachers. Who wouldn't be proud to have a son like my Edward? There was other happy news too. Starla was pregnant again! That really changed things in the Veilleux house. Up until now, we'd always lived a very, very cramped lifestyle because of these restrictions, but now we were able to build onto our house and spread out more. It was wonderful. My wife really did change things for the better. Things weren't all great in the Veilleux household though. But we just dealt with them as best we could, and eventually they quieted down again. Things grew more peaceful for us as a family. Family dinners were common place for us. Now that she was the mayor, she didn't have to spend quite so much time at the office, so she was able to spend a lot more time at home, which was good, since this pregnancy had been very hard on her. Edward helped out a lot around the house, doing little every day tasks here and there so that his mother wouldn't have to, and I knew that she appreciated it. I just loved to watch the two of them together. They really had a close bond with each other. It's not often you see that kind of bond between a mother and her teenage son, so I thought it made their relationship even more special. Etoile wasn't left out though. She was still one of the happiest children in the world. She and Whiskers were best friends. Etoile spent a lot of time with him, giving him lots of love and teaching him tricks. Our babies were so beautiful, so precious. I knew that I would do anything for them, give my life for them, just as I would for Starla and for Edward and Etoile. I spent every day at work unable to wait to get home so that I could spend time with the babies. I didn't even mind changing their diapers, which I'm sure made Starla happy, since it definitely wasn't her favourite chore. I didn't mind though. Every second I got to spend with them was precious. I didn't want to miss a moment of their lives. Edward and Etoile weren't ignored. They had a lot of fun themselves. Edward was a great older brother to Etoile, always showering her with attention and making her feel loved. Though sometimes he went a little overboard with the games. Now that our family was growing, and Starla's hard work in changing building codes had been successful, we expanded the house a little bit. It was nice to be able to spread out a little bit more. My family and I loved each other, but we all needed space from time to time. Now we've got it! And of course, we really needed that space. The babies were growing up so quickly! Before we knew it, Faith and Finn were crawling around all over the place, getting into all sorts of trouble. But we could never stay frustrated for long, not when they flashed their adorable little smiles. I fully admit, they had be wrapped around their little fingers. Alright, so I realize it's been like, eight months since I've updated, but....I'm back! Hehe. The reason for my being gone is an eclectic mix of ridiculous computer troubles, losing my AL cd (thank God I'm able to use the Mansion and Garden SP), buying and being obsessed with all things Wii, borrowing my sister's Xbox 360 and being obsessed with Fable II, the fact that I watch WAY too many tv shows, which all started again, and just plain being lazy. But I'm back! And hopefully, I'll be able to crank things out with more regularity in the future. Fingers crossed. Anyway though, I....don't really remember much about what's happened in the past besides the fact that Demetrius was named heir and he's god an adorable girlfriend named Starla, who he's been dating since he was a teenager. The other five kids have all either become townies, or, if I liked them enough, as in the case with Deandra and Chester, moved into a house across town. Now, shall we get started? Alright! Life was moving on. My siblings and cousins had all moved out to start their own families, and I was all that was left of the "kids" in the house. Well, that's not exactly true. I asked Starla to move in, and she said yes! She didn't have many possessions, but that was okay. My family had possessions enough, and the money to buy more or less anything she wanted. My parents and my aunt and uncle were just glad to have the addition to the family. And I was so happy that my love wanted to be with me! Life continued on. Uncle Adder and Aunt Ronnie were getting along great again after Uncle Adder's little....tryst with his college "friend." It'd taken a long time, but she'd finally forgiven him. Mom and dad were both doing really well too. Mom was still really into reading and learning everything she could, just like she'd always been, and Dad, well, he's always been a big kid. I don't think that that'll ever change. I hoped it wouldn't. His playful and carefree attitude made him the man he is, and it was what had drawn serious Mom to him in the first place. I hoped that Starla and I would have a relationship as loving and long-lasting as that of my parents. But first, I had to ask her to marry me! I'd wanted to make it a special occasion, but one night, as we were getting ready for bed, I looked at her, and she was so beautiful, that I just couldn't wait a second longer. So I got down one knee, right there by the bed, and asked her to be my wife. She was so surprised. But she'd said yes! I couldn't believe it. I was so happy. I immediately hugged her and spun her around in my arms, laughing joyously. She was just as happy and excited. That night, we, uh, celebrated until the sun came up. What a night! Not too long after that, Starla began to feel sick, and she had no energy at all. There were numerous times when I'd find her asleep on the couch in the middle of the day, and sometimes she even fell asleep standing up! At first we'd thought she'd picked up a bug or that her job as a campaign manager was putting too much stress on her, but being a nurse and studying to become a doctor, it quickly became clear to me that she was pregnant. Mom and Aunt Ronnie both agreed. They remembered what it was like to be pregnant. We were going to have a baby! So, as quickly as possible, Starla and I got married. Starla had wanted the big day to come before she started to show, so that any pictures taken would show her before she "packed on the pounds," as she'd said. I told her that I would find her beautiful no matter how pregnant she was, but I wanted to give her what she wanted. It was a beautiful little ceremony with just my parents and Aunt Ronnie and Uncle Adder. And even though it was just a small, informal event, it was the happiest day of my life, and I knew that Starla felt the same way. Her pregnancy was very difficult for her. She just never had any energy for anything. She wasn't able to take time off of work--none of us were--so by the time she got home, she was out. Aunt Ronnie thought that this was just hilarious. I thought it was pretty rude of her to laugh at Starla like that, but Starla just shrugged it off with a little chuckle of her own. "She knows what it's like to be pregnant," she reasoned. Life went on again, pretty much as normal, except that Starla was getting bigger, and more and more beautiful to me. Dad and Uncle Adder were spending a lot of time together lately. Joel was quite a bit older than Adder, so for a long time, they just didn't see eye to eye on a lot of things. Now that they were both older though, they seemed to have a lot more in common. They talked a lot about their youths, comparing stories and reminiscing about the days when their kids were small and growing up. It was nice to see them spending so much time together. Aunt Ronnie insisted on painting a portrait of me since I was the heir of the family. How could I say now? And mom still spent a lot of time reading. Everyone in the house was happy. It was a very peaceful place, which was great for Starla, and just what she needed when she came home from a stressful day at work. My parents and my aunt and uncle were always ready to get her anything she needed or to do anything for her. I tried my best too, though I had to spend long hours at work. Studying to be a doctor was hard work! We did spend lots of time together, as much as we could between both of our jobs and her waning energy. When she did have enough energy, we'd play a game of catch or something active. She was determined to stay somewhat active, or else she'd never get rid of the baby weight afterward, she said. It was a very happy day in the household when Edward came into the world. He was a beautiful baby, and he had Starla's eyes and her bright red hair. He took my breath away, every time I looked at him. Starla was a wonderful mother, just as I'd known she'd be. Everyone was great with him. And with six adults in the house, Edward was very loved and never left wanting. I have to admit, we all spoiled him quite a bit those first few months. Mom and dad were thrilled to have a baby in the house, and so were Uncle Adder and Aunt Ronnie. Everyone loved Edward and just showered him with love and affection. And he was growing so fast! Deandra and I had been the youngest of our generation, but I definitely don't remember any of us kids growing as fast as Edward did. One moment, he was a newborn, and the next, he was a toddler, effortlessly garnering attention wherever he went. He was really smart too! Mom and Aunt Ronnie both agreed that none of my siblings and cousins or I had ever learned to use the potty as quickly as Edward did. And almost as soon as he was able to walk, Edward managed to find a way to get out of his crib. This was sometimes hazardous, as he'd often wander off somewhere once he was out of his crib, and it'd take us awhile to find him. He could almost always be found with Jack though. He loved that doll. Wherever Jack was, Edward was never far, and vice versa. It was adorable, watching him with that doll. He definitely had some pipes though. Edward was more or less a happy toddler, but when he was cranky, he was loud, and it was difficult to soothe him, especially if he was tired. And if Jack got lost? He wouldn't stop crying until we found him. We made sure Jack was always in sight whenever we could. My cousin Calla came over often for dinner and just to visit with us and mostly Uncle Adder and Aunt Ronnie, and Edward loved her. She was his favourite person to play with, and she always played with him. She could keep him occupied and happy for hours. And she loved spending time with him too. There were numerous times when she baby-sat when Starla and I needed to get away for some time to ourselves. Uncle Adder and Aunt Ronnie's relationship was definitely back to normal. He was always doing romantic things for her, like bringing her flowers and chocolates and things like that. And even though I thought that watching my aunt and uncle make out on the couch was pretty gross, Starla thought it was so romantic and sweet, and I guess she was right. I just didn't want to see it. One day though, it all came to an end for them. I don't think any of us saw it coming, but especially not Uncle Adder. Even though he was the youngest of everyone from their generation, he'd had a really good life, a long and happy and healthy one, so he didn't fight Grim when he came to take him away. We were all very sad, but Aunt Ronnie was heartbroken. She'd loved him so much, for most of her life. She'd felt guilty too. The two of them had been...well, they'd been having some "fun" on the couch just before Grim came, and she blamed herself for his death. She'd thought that maybe they were too rough or something. Although all of us tried our hardest to keep those images out of our heads, we all comforted her and tried to reassure her that none of it had been her fault. We weren't the only one's affected by Uncle Adder's death. Edward was extremely upset by it and went through a really tough period then. He was cranky all the time for what felt like ages after Uncle Adder died, and nothing we did could soothe him. Nothing but comfort from Aunt Ronnie. She was still hurting terribly from losing the love of her life, but she soothed Edward when he cried. They got each other through it all, I think. They had a really close bond after that. Meanwhile, I'd been hearing reports at the hospital about men and women being abducted and then let go several hours later. But the even weirder part about these stories was that the men who were abducted were apparently left pregnant, and nine months later, gave birth to a human/alien hybrid. I couldn't believe it! As far as I knew there had been no actual studies done, so I thought I'd run a little study myself. First, try to lure the aliens to me. I wasn't at all sure that they even existed yet, so my first task was to prove that they did. I had no luck for several weeks. I was growing tired of going out every night, trying to lure aliens that I had no proof even existed. I was beginning to think it was just a big hoax, like Big Foot or the Loch Ness Monster, and I was just about to give up, but one night, something happened to prove me wrong. I think I screamed when the spaceship beamed me up, because I vaguely remember Starla rushing out to see what had happened. She was worried beyond belief when she saw me being eaten by the spaceship, she'd told me later. Mom had run out a little bit later. She didn't believe Starla at all when she'd told her what had happened. She laughed hard, thinking it was all some practical joke. When I didn't come back for several hours, then she realized that Star must've been telling the truth. I was more than a little bit freaked out when they finally let me go. I don't remember much of what happened. I just vaguely remember feeling different sensations of every kind, from the most excruciating pain to the most intense pleasure I've ever felt, and everything in between. I couldn't believe I'd just been abducted my aliens! As soon as I calmed down enough, I ran inside and wrote down everything I remembered. I would need to include all of this in my study. And every day, I took all sorts of measurements of my body and lots of observations, keeping track of my pregnancy--which I quickly confirmed it was. As the weeks passed, I quickly found out that I had many of the same symptoms that pregnant women often experienced, including morning sickness. I think that that was the worst part of it in those first few months. Through all of this Edward was still a very energetic toddler, always getting into trouble, keeping everyone on our toes. And since I found myself dealing with work, my studies and this pregnancy, Starla was the one who gave Edward the most attention, playing with him, reading bedtime stories to him, comforting him when he fell. She was a great mother. I felt incredibly lucky to be able to call her my wife. Time passed, and I kept getting bigger and bigger. How bizarre! It was fascinating and scary at the same time. But as I continued through my pregnancy, the study I was conducting became less and less important as the bond between me and my unborn child grew. How could I do a study on an innocent child? I still recorded any changes in my body, but ultimately, I decided that I wasn't going to continue on with the study. Meanwhile, Edward was still growing up way too quickly. Before we all knew it, he was five years old, all ready to start school. He was so excited. On his first day of school, he got up very early, before dawn even, to get ready. He would be tired that night, but there was just no going back to sleep again. He was still a very good child. He always had a hug for everyone in the family before he left to catch the bus, and again when he got home from school, and again right before bed. And he was still smart as anything. Starla and I had taught him that studying was important, and we showed him that too. We had a deal that when he studied and did his homework, so did we. Since it was a family affair, and since he could see that even grown ups had to hit the books, it made him more agreeable towards homework, even when he'd rather play with his toys instead. It'd been a few years since Uncle Adder had passed away, but Aunt Ronnie still missed him terribly. I don't think she ever really got over his death, no matter how much time passed, no matter how many times we told her it hadn't been her fault. She didn't blame herself anymore, at least. She'd made peace with herself there, but it didn't stop her from missing him. She always would. I, meanwhile, was having a terrible time with my pregnancy, at least as terrible a time as Starla had had when she'd been pregnant with Edward. Of course this felt so much worse than what I remembered her feeling. I never had any energy and often fell asleep in my food, too hungry to go to bed and too sleepy to eat. I also had to go to the bathroom all the time. I swore that baby purposely stomped on my bladder, just to make me even more uncomfortable. All of this really began to freak me out. What if I couldn't do this? What if alien/human hybrid babies ate different things, required nutrients that didn't exist on this planet? And assuming it was able to thrive here, what would happen when it entered school? Would it be teased by everyone? But no, there were all sorts of different-looking people, many side effects from the explosion. Uncle Adder was a perfect example, and so was Starla. But even telling myself these things, I was still very worried about having this baby. Mom and Dad were both really great though. Both of them rubbed my stomach often and talked to my baby and gave it lots of love. Starla and Edward and Aunt Ronnie were great too. Just by loving me and my unborn baby, they soothed my fears and helped me to understand that no matter what happened, our family would be alright, including the baby. All together, we could work through anything. One night Dad was just getting ready for bed when Uncle Adder visited him. He couldn't say much, of course, but he seemed to be telling Dad to say goodbye. He kept saying the words over and over again. Dad had said, later on, that he'd felt a chill run down his spine then, and that he'd known that his life was coming to an end. He didn't tell anyone about it though, not wanting his last days to be spent in sadness. He was extremely surprised then, when Grim didn't come for him, but for Mom instead. Uncle Adder hadn't been telling him to say goodbye to all of us because he was going to die, but to say goodbye to Mom, because it was her time to go. Dad was very angry with everything for a long time after that. How dare death take his wife instead of him? He was the one who was supposed to die, he thought, not my mom. He missed her so much. She'd been the love of his life, the woman he'd loved for almost fifty years. It was extremely hard for him to live without her. Edward was very upset about it too. He and his grandma had been very close, and since he'd been so young when Uncle Adder had died, my mom's death had more or less been the first one he'd ever experienced. He'd taken it very hard, but with time, and with lots of love from Starla and I and the rest of the family, he slowly began to move on. Dad was finding it much more difficult to move on. Aunt Ronnie understood. They began to spend a lot of time together, talking about my mom and Uncle Adder, remembering them. They'd even begun to sleep in the same bed. I'm pretty sure nothing sexual ever came of it--I really hope not. I think it was just a comfort thing. Neither one of them felt like they could sleep alone. They helped each other out. Finally, the day came when my pregnancy would finally come to an end. It hurt. A lot. And it seemed to take forever. How did women do this? The pain had been excruciating. As much as I loved kids, it was nothing that I ever wanted to do ever again. Starla could have the next one. In the end, though, it was all worth it. All the pain, the discomfort, the fatigue, the morning sickness....it was all worth it because I held a miracle in my hands: my new baby girl. My daughter...my Etoile.
